business.headline: 18% GST on used cars: Will it leave you paying more?The decision has sparked debates as it comes at a time when India's used car market is poised for growth. Many believe the move aims to tap into the rapidly expanding sector to boost government revenue.
Tata Capital IPO buzz? All you need to knowIf the IPO goes through, it will be the Tata Group's second public offering in two decades. The last one was Tata Technologies' IPO in November last year.

Who is Aakash Chaudhry? Zerodha, Zomato founders bet on Sparkl EdventureInvestors include Zomato founder Deepinder Goyal and Zerodha founder Nithin Kamath, who have backed the platform that aims to transform personalised learning for students.

Sanathan Textiles IPO allotment: Check step-by-step guide to check statusSanathan Textiles IPO: Investors can verify their allotment status through two platforms: the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the KFin Technologies portal. Here's a step-by-step guide:

Apple nears $4 trillion valuation amid AI push and iPhone upgrade hopesApple's strategic push into AI and its resilience in navigating market challenges have positioned the tech giant as a leader in the sector.
Greaves Cotton share price gains over 10% today. What's behind the rally? Greaves Cotton stock price: The company's shares were trading 10.25% higher at Rs 252.70 on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Explained: Why Tata Investment share price jumped 12% todayTata Investment stock price: At 11:53 am, shares of the company were up 11.51% to Rs 7,284 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). The surge followed reports that Tata Capital is gearing up for an initial public offering (IPO) worth Rs 15,000 crore.

Are stock markets closed on December 25? Check the full 2025 holiday scheduleOn regular weekdays, the stock market operates from 9:15 AM to 3:30 PM. A pre-opening session takes place from 9:00 AM to 9:15 AM to set the tone for the trading day.

Which insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Carraro India IPO: Check GMP, price band and subscription statusCarraro India IPO is a Rs 1,250 crore offer for sale (OFS) consisting of 1.77 crore shares. As this is a pure OFS, the entire proceeds will go to the selling shareholders, and the company will not raise fresh capital.

Senores Pharmaceuticals IPO: Latest subscription status, GMP; listing dateSenores Pharmaceuticals IPO: The IPO comprises a fresh issue of shares worth Rs 500 crore and an offer-for-sale (OFS) of up to 21,00,000 equity shares by promoters and existing shareholders.

Sagility India share price rises 5% to hit upper circuit today. Here's why Sagility India debuted on the stock market with an issue price of Rs 30 per share. At its current level, the stock has surged over 63% from the IPO price, underscoring strong investor interest.

Ventive Hospitality IPO: Check GMP as listing enters last day for biddingRetail investors must apply for a minimum of 23 shares per lot, which requires a minimum investment of Rs 14,789 for retail applicants.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as market rally loses steam; TCS gains 1% The S&P BSE Sensex was up 47.25 points to 78,587.42, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 10.80 points to 23,764.25 as of 9:30 AM.

DAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusDAM Capital Advisors IPO allotment: The allotment status can be checked by investors through the websites of either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) or Link Intime India Private Ltd, the registrar for the issue.

Mamata Machinery IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing date Mamata Machinery IPO allotment: Investors who have bid can check their allotment status online by logging in to either the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website or the website of Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Stocks to watch today: Wipro, Vedanta, Adani Enterprises, TVS Motor Several companies are expected to remain in focus due to recent developments. Among them are Vedanta, Prestige Estates, Wipro, Adani Enterprises, and TVS Motor.
IPOs in 2024: Big ticket listings that failed to impressRecord-breaking IPOs in India coexist with the struggles of billion-dollar listings, reflecting both market resilience and investor caution.
Sensex ends 400 points higher, Nifty jumps as heavyweight stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex added 498.58 points to end at 78,540.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 165.95 points to close at 23,753.45.

NSE, BSE to keep markets open on February 1 for Union Budget 2025The practice of keeping markets open during Budget Day is not new. In the past, trading was also allowed on non-working days to facilitate real-time market reactions to Budget announcements.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Integrity eroding: Congress goes to Supreme Court over election rule tweakThe government has tweaked an election rule to prevent public inspection of certain electronic documents such as CCTV camera and webcasting footage as well as video recordings of candidates to prevent their misuse.

Pushpa 2 stampede case: Allu Arjun grilled by Hyderabad cops for 4 hours  Live UpdatesAllu Arjun was questioned by the Hyderabad Police for four hours over the death of a 35-year-old woman in a stampede at Sandhya Theatre during Pushpa 2's premiere on December 4.

Should have made Manu Bhaker a cricketer, not shooter: Father on Khel Ratna snubDouble Olympic medallist Manu Bhaker was reportedly snubbed from the Khel Ratna nominees list. Manu's father reacted to the reports and said that he should have made his daughter a cricketer and not a shooter.

Which insurance companies reject claims the least? Report reveals truthPeople don't just put in money but trust when they buy insurance policies to cover for medical emergencies or motor accidents. A report by the Insurance Brokers Association of India reveals how many such claims have been accepted or rejected by insurance companies in 2022-23.

Alcohol khatam, farsaan baaki: Did Gujarat-Thailand flyers hit booze limit?People on the first Air India flight from Surat to Bangkok claimed that they had polished off the entire alcohol stock on the plane. Air India Express officials refuted the claim, saying it was well-stocked. Did the passengers hit an unofficial limit on alcohol servings? Who takes such a call mid-air?

What Allu Arjun was asked by cops in Pushpa 2 stampede caseAllu Arjun, who is out on bail in the case, appeared before police for questioning in connection with the stampede at Sandhya theatre that left a woman dead and her son critical.

Flawed selection process: Congress on appointment of human rights panel chiefCongress leaders Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge said the selection process of the NHRC chief was "flawed" and showed the "dismissive approach of the government".

No regrets about not captaining India, but would have enjoyed it: R AshwinR Ashwin played 106 Tests and took 537 wickets, but the legendary off-spinner did not get an opportunity to lead the senior national team in the longest format of the game. Ashwin retired from international cricket on December 18.
Satellites reveal how fast the Greenland ice sheet is disappearingBetween 2010 and 2023, the Greenland Ice Sheet experienced an average thinning of 1.2 meters.

Swiss flight makes emergency landing in Austria after smoke in cabin, cockpitThe airline reported that the crew decided to abort the flight after detecting engine trouble and smoke aboard. All passengers were safely evacuated.

Watch: Vinod Kambli sings from hospital bed, shares positive health updateFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli appeared emotional as he spoke to the media from a private hospital in Thane on Tuesday. The member of 1996 World Cup team was hospitalised on Saturday after his health deteriorated.

Shyam Benegal funeral: Renowned filmmaker creamted with state honoursCelebrated filmmaker Shyam Benegal died on Monday at the Wockhardt Hospital in Mumbai. He was 90. The filmmaker had been suffering from a chronic kidney-related disease. His funeral will take place at Mumbai's Shivaji Park Electric Crematarium on Tuesday.

Video: Baby gorilla wearing a t-shirt rescued from crate at Istanbul airport  A baby gorilla, dressed in a tiny t-shirt, was rescued from a smuggling attempt at Istanbul Airport. Turkish authorities shared a video of the gorilla in a post on X.

Bangladesh launches $5 billion corruption probe against Sheikh Hasina, familyA probe has been launched in Bangladesh to investigate former prime minister Sheikh Hasina after allegations of misappropriating $5 billion in the construction of the Rooppur nuclear power plant.

Illegal immigration racket busted in Delhi, 5 Bangladeshi nationals arrestedDelhi Police busted an illegal immigration racket involving Bangladeshi nationals and fake document syndicates, arresting 11 individuals.

Chandigarh civic body meet turns into WWE ring over Ambedkar remarks rowThe trigger for the scuffle was a motion passed by Congress and AAP councillors demanding Union Home Minister Amit Shah's resignation over his remarks on BR Ambedkar.
Kilauea volcano erupts unleashing spectacular lava lake flowsThe lava flows have already overtaken a previous lava lake formed during earlier eruptions.

Naya Bangladesh trading-off 1971 rape-murder horrors for Pakistan embrace?Bangladesh has always been demanding an "apology for the 1971 genocide" from Pakistan. But the caretaker government headed by Muhammad Yunus has now diluted the stand, calling for a "resolution of the issues". With this shift, Naya Bangladesh is erasing the horrors of 1971, when the Pakistani army killed around 400,000 Bengalis and raped thousands of women.

Agra gym trainer, posing as RAW agent, rapes Canadian woman he met on TinderOn her return to Canada, the woman found that she was pregnant. When she informed him of her condition, the gym trainer, Sahil, threatened and blocked her.

Hospitals can't refuse free treatment to rape, acid attack survivors: High CourtThe Delhi High Court said denying treatment to sexual assault victims was an offence for which the doctors, staff and management of the hospital could be penalised.
Honda-Nissan: As merger discussions begin, see where 2 companies stand in IndiaHonda Cars India and Nissan Motor India are facing headwinds in the domestic market for multiple reasons.

Uber reacts to man's claim of different fares for same trip on different phonesSharing his experience in a post, the man noted, "Same pickup point, destination, and time but two different phones get two different rates. It happens with me as I always get higher rates on my Uber compared to my daughter's phone."

Sunny Leone condemns fraudulent use of her name in Chhattisgarh schemeSunny Leone condemned a fraud incident where her name was falsely used to claim Chhattisgarh government benefits. Authorities have filed an FIR, frozen the accused's account, and started recovery.

'House of horror': US gay couple gets 100 years in jail for raping adopted sonsWhat was not visible to the world was the unspeakable atrocities that were committed under the guise of a picture-perfect family.

Diljit Dosanjh to wrap Dil-Luminati tour in Ludhiana, tickets sell out in minutesDiljit Dosanjh will conclude his Dil-Luminati tour in Ludhiana on December 31. Tickets for the concert were sold out instantly.

Virat Kohli looks rock solid in nets, urges fans not to make noiseBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: India star batter Virat Kohli displayed impeccable technique in the nets at the Melbourne Cricket Ground ahead of the Boxing Day Test. Kohli also urged the fans not to make noise in the practice session.

Jangoo earns maiden Test call-up as West Indies name squad for Pakistan tourWest Indies batter Amir Jangoo received his first call-up to the test squad, while left-arm spinner Gudakesh Motie returns for next month's series against Pakistan, the team said on Monday.

Gill needs to back his defensive technique to shine in Australia: PontingBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Former Australian captain Ricky Ponting offered insights into how Shubman Gill could improve his performances in challenging conditions like Australia.

England Test captain Ben Stokes out for three months due to torn hamstring England captain Ben Stokes has vowed to endure "blood, sweat, and tears" for England as he prepares for surgery in January. The all-rounder is set to be sidelined for at least three months due to a torn hamstring.

Vinod Kambli has clots in brain, reveals doctor after medical examinationsFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli has been hospitalised in Thane after his health deteriorated and the medical examinations have revealed that the cricketer has clots in his brain.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
